TopicTitle: Apollo Mission Recreation (And More!) [Requesting Ground Crew Aid!]

Articles.Content:
We really need to sort out all the ground crews shifts, its gunna get cluttered if we don't do it soon

I was working on it.
Now that was a bombshell: we are planning for a livestream when Squad suddenly announces: 1.0.5 is out!!....

Now that was a bombshell: we are planning for a livestream when Squad suddenly announces: 1.0.5 is out!!....

That's early!

Hey guys,

If you're not already part of the steam group, please post your steam names here so I can add you.
I don't have steam

I don't have steam

We will open a Skype ground sometime.

- - - Updated - - -

Now that was a bombshell: we are planning for a livestream when Squad suddenly announces: 1.0.5 is out!!....

We will still use 1.0.4 for a long duration due to mod compatibility. It is possible with its sudden release so soon, that mods could catch up and be updated for 1.0.5, and if that happens I will make an announcement on the Steam/Skype group telling you all about it.

We will open a Skype ground sometime.

Well, considering that many are being updated atm, and probably some still works, i don't think it will take long for all mods to be compatible.

Well, considering that many are being updated atm, and probably some still works, i don't think it will take long for all mods to be compatible.

I wanted to confirm one thing- are we using the Saturn I or the Saturn IB? They are two difference launch vehicles, and I don't think that FASA has the Saturn I parts.

I wanted to confirm one thing- are we using the Saturn I or the Saturn IB? They are two difference launch vehicles, and I don't think that FASA has the Saturn I parts.

I think the S-1B is preferable as we are doing manned flights

I wanted to confirm one thing- are we using the Saturn I or the Saturn IB? They are two difference launch vehicles, and I don't think that FASA has the Saturn I parts.
I think the S-1B is preferable as we are doing manned flights

For launching the sats ? ZNG mentioned using a Saturn I (which I personally find overkill with its 9t to LEO, but we'll try to stick with Apollo hardware), a IB would just be too powerfuln unless your comsats are 15t.

The current plan does not involve launching manned missions with a Saturn IB. Either solutions (Apollo 6 and 8 as they happened or unmanned 8 and manned 6) include using a Saturn V as launcher.

I think the S-1B is preferable as we are doing manned flights

I meant for the comsat launch on Saturday (Saturnday ) I can/am working on a comsat to GEO. I might be able to do that in 9,000 kg, but 21,000 kg is easier.

Really? I didn't see any S-I parts there, especially the second stage.

Ugh. There's got to be a mod with a S1 in it. Besides, did you look in the CRAFTS folder? Since there's not likely going to be S1 specific parts. The whole Saturn rocket family are just simple derivatives of the Saturn V. Each rocket taking one or more peices from the SV. This is obvious since Von Braun was more partial to incremental test launches, where you'd launch each segment individually and see how they perform, unlike the Apollo 4 mission which was essentially a full up launch test with the whole Saturn V.

Edited November 11, 2015 by ZooNamedGames
I would love to at least watch a live stream, as much realism as possible!

I would love to at least watch a live stream, as much realism as possible!

There's a launch this Saturday! We will be launching a Comsat into LEO for the following series of missions to the moon. Each one will require the same skills, dedication and work as the real manned launch will need. So this will be a practice, so feel free to show.

Also, if you are going to stream this, anybody/whoever, please let me know so you get credit and can get good material and get everything you need to see/hear. Lastly add it to the KSP streaming calendar.
